Irvine Spectrum Center.name: Irvine Spectrum Center
reviews:
First visited this place when it was only a movie theater and a few restaurants n shops (10 yrs ago) now it’s huge with major brand stores! And they are still adding on and building . It’s become a major shopping hub with excellent restaurants and plenty of free parking . With a major Ferris wheel and ice skating ⛸ during the winter. Fun for the whole family . A tour group could spend the whole day ! It’s either here or South Coast Plaza for me .
Show less
Lots of food choices with the shopping

The quality (price points) of the stores here aren’t as high as the Fashion Island Mall, but they are still quite nice. The food selection at this mall is very good and it also has movie theaters in the same area as the food and shopping. The layout is very good and practical. I noticed a train for children that meanders through the space and a Ferris wheel too.
Show less
Retail therapy on steroids, restaurants galore

The Spectrum Center is most popular in summer months when swarms of teenagers descend to eat, go to the movies and hang out. The rest of the year, there are more locals there, many to eat at the ever increasing number of restaurants. Retail tends to the teens and young adults, although there is a Nordstrom for higher end products and Target for the normal things. Lots of noise, color, and great people watching. Dress casual, dressing up here in a clean t shirt and shorts without rips.
Show less
Average for shopping, not too many choices
Was recommended by some when my family and I were out at desert hills, in comparison fairly average for shopping
One of the places to be in the O.C.

This is the place to be in Orange County. This shopping center is not as large as the South Coast Shopping Center in Costa Mesa, but it has almost everything you need for the shopping experience. In addition, it has a large Ferris Wheel and Carousel for the kids as well as a motorized train ride that goes through a fair bit of the shopping center. It has lots of stores and some are unique. It is anchored by Nordstroms and Target and has tons of great restaurants. This is the place to be at night as it is magical to see the lights on the attractions and there is life to the place.
Show less
Hung out there for half a day and loved all the food and shop options. Great Restaurants and great shops!
Lively place to shop & eat with the variety of establishments it has. Free shuttle service from nearby Marriott Courtyard. Classy & clean environment.

I’m very familiar with the Irvine Spectrum, it’s my family’s go-to” for everything from Nordstrom’s, Target, movies, food and general free time-filling entertainment.
The humongous movie theatre is state-of-the-art, worth splurging on recliners for big family movie nights. In-seat food & bar service are awesome!
While shopping is probably not the biggest draw of this center, the people-watching, unique kiosks, and general entertainment are. From The huge Ferris Wheel, beautiful Carosel, Dave & Busters, virtual reality gaming/racing, to the “Hello Kitty” pop-up, this center can be eye-popping. And, outdoor ice skating in the winter months with plentiful seating to sit back and take it all in.
There is an abundance of eating options as well. From affordable to impressive, it’s good for little kiddos, multi-family meals, first date impressions, and power lunches. My new fave place is “Habana”, retro Cuban to the core but, So Cal in its wow factor.

Great for young families & and moms with strollers. Lots to see, and play. Bubble fountains, trains, ice cream, and lots of walking

Cons: really crowded week-end evenings (not an issue during the day), don’t expect to pop-in for a quick meal after 5:00. Every place is packed. If you’re not accustomed to a variety of cultures this may not be a comfortable place for you, especially Friday nights. I personally love it but, I know some people are put-off.
While there is a vast abundance of parking lots & spaces it still can take time & patience to find a spot, rest assured: you will.
Lots of new construction for additional experiences, don’t let that keep you away. It’s all neatly organized and hidden. Irvine Company does everything possible to ensure their properties are always stellar, ahead of any and all competition.
One last note: this is a wildly confusing center logistically. Keep your eye on the directories & maps to figure out where you are and where you’re going. Easy to get lost & confused.

Have fun!
Show less
Variety of shops, eats and entertainment
Amusement rides, shopping and dining, Spectrum Center has it all. From a few hours to all day, this is a great place for family, business or just to relax and get away.

On a business trip to Irvine staying in a hotel close to the Spectrum Center. Beautiful immaculate grounds and fountains. Great restaurants great service nice variety of shops friendly people. Made me want to live in Irvine!

Our family used to visit the Spectrum mall every other weekend. My toddler loved riding the train. During the summer, the mall hosted "toddler tuesdays". It was packed so if they host this summer, arrive early for free kids activities.

The stores have smaller selections than other retail chains but we never went for the shopping - Although we always managed to either eat at one of the many food choices or buy something for the kids.
Show less
A little like shopping in a theme park...

I have never really understood the concept here. This can explain my infrequent visits. While there are many good stores and restaurants, they are what for me has become and exercise in walking past at least half of them who cater to an audience younger in age. We had an hour to wait until our movie began, and had enough time to explore a bit of the center. Have not been to a Comedy Club in years and my interest is now back while walking past The Improve. Looked into some promising restaurants, a bit on the high $ side for entrees, but on a Thursday night at 7:30 PM, doing well. If only the 405 South were a bit less used between 4 and 7, we would more than likely be here more often.
Show less
Visiting my daughter and her fiance there.
I was in the park area, which has a cafe, dog park, soccer field, gazebo and play area for the kids. Beautiful area. Quite lovely.

This is the only mall shopping in Irvine. Irvine has plenty of strip malls but if you want to do any non grocery store, non Target shopping, you will have to come here. Parking structure is large and there is a ferris wheel there. Restaurants and traditional mall stores. Not surprising that it’s very busy on weekends.
Show less

Went to dinner with our daughter and fiancé at Del Frisco’s. Always a very vibrant scene with wonderful servers. All of our meals were fabulous and our server was very prompt and attentive. Their appetizers are phenomenal!
Huge outdoor and indoor mall with difficult parking

It took me almost an hour to find parking space at this mall during Christmas holiday. The atmosphere is relaxing and lots of restaurants, shops and attractions at this mall. However, we picked the wrong restaurant, Seoul Urban which is I didn't recommend if looking for Korean food. During normal season, it shouldn't be difficult to find parking because they have lots of parking space. A main destination when visiting Irvine, CA.
Show less

Incompetent personnel and bad repair quality. Brought in a MacBook Pro Retina for battery replacement. The store took all my information and accepted the device. When stopped to pick up the machine, I was told that only my wife could get the device, as it is registered in her name. It took 30 minutes of conversations with different employees to get the laptop. Upon inspection of the laptop noticed a lot of scratches on the bottom part. The employee stated that the repair did not even open the bottom part as the "top case" was replaced only. The long story short - the bottom part is called "the top case". So instead of replacing the old part with a new one, Apple repair installed a _used part_. According to Apple - this is their standard policy. Not sure, if incompetent employees are included in the policy.
Show less
Lots Here, Crowded, Parking is Difficult
We enjoy visiting the Spectrum for dinner, movies, and people watching. The only drawback is the parking if often difficult to find spaces especially during popular times (nights, weekends).
Average mall - the outlets are better

It is a nice mall if not going for the stores but spending an evening out. The stores are not very many compared to the outlets in California. There is going on some construction work so probably will be different in the summer of 2018.
Combined with the other stores across the 405 it is a great plaza where you can find pretty much everything you need. Parking is usually a struggle but they have valet!

Whether you're shopping, strolling or looking for entertainment, the Spectrum has something for you. We spent the day there and shuttled over from our Doubletree by Hilton hotel--a real plus. We enjoyed burgers, Dave & Busters and hamburgers, and had a lovely day.

We come here regularly for the movie theatre which is great. Also excellent valet parking right at the front and a good variety of food options. The rest of the center though is missing something-I can’t put my finger on it but the place is dead. I find myself walking through sort of aimlessly and even impulse shopping doesn’t happen here-maybe it’s the mix of shops or the layout with some dead ends and awkward corners but aside from the theatre, nothing here would make me come south of South Coast Plaza or Fashion Island.
Show less
Always pleasure to walk around the area looking at different stores and eating at various restaurants, shopping at Target and going to movies. Parking never a problem when we went there.
It is very good to walk in this place for the Young children. They are safe. The different shops are important and privés are good. The People are very gentle.
Perfect center outdoors plenty of parking an amazing selection of stores to choose from. Great place highly recommended
Great place to eat see a movie walk around and go on the wheel ride the places in here a very clean and have reasonable prices.

I never really thought to make a review of Irvine Spectrum since I always just took it for granted, but I might as well give my two cents on it now.

I've been coming here since I was a little boy and it has been through many changes. I remember there used to be a Medieval Times store, a Love Sac store, and a magician store filled with quirky items like puppets and the like all in the same court. There was more space for parking before, but now that's been filled in with new businesses, which makes things a bit more congested and bottle-necked. The Macy's as well has since been demolished and smaller stores will fill in the void. The Improv Comedy Club is still here, but was moved to a spot near the movie theater. The old space has been replaced with a Kona Grill (which I might check out one of these days).

The movie theater is fantastic and has a lot of screens for new movies, including IMAX where I remember seeing Batman Returns, The Lion King, Star Wars: The Force Awakens, and Interstellar (in 70 mm.). The prices are a bit expensive but I'm a Regal Club member which allows me to get free movie tickets sometimes (I've seen Wolf of Wall Street and Thor: Ragnorak at this theater for free). There is a Dave and Busters, Target, Barnes and Noble, Apple (where I bought the MacBook Air that I'm writing this review with) and other stores, along with multiple restaurants like Subway, The Yard House, Red Robin, Chipotle, Ruby's, CPK and more. The architecture is really nice and timeless, reflecting the region's Spanish heritage while also throwing in some Moorish/Islamic elements similar to the Alhambra. They also have a ferris wheel and carousel and while I've never been on either they both make this place more family friendly and help Irvine Spectrum stand out from other malls and shopping centers. One of the quirky newer additions I like is The Ride 7D, which operates like Star Tours at Disneyland only you shoot at things on the screen.

I have to be honest, this is practically a second home for me. I see people from all ethnicities and backgrounds walking around me which helps make this place so vibrant and full of life. It has the right amount of high-end shops and middle-class fare that appeals to the whole spectrum (no pun intended) and brings everybody in. Definitely one of the best malls I know of.
Show less
The mall is fantastic, there is a hello kitty cafe that has AMAZING little cakes, and of course theres the ferris wheel!
Parking is horrendous, stores and restaurants are fabulous!

Easy access at the 5/405 split.

Parking is basically a nightmare. If you have a dinner reservation (go to the new HABANA RESTAURANT, it’s fabulous!) be sure to allow an extra 15 minutes to park.

I know, they have valet stations but they’re not always easily accessed.

Great restaurants and some great retail outlets that just aren’t around at other places. Where else can you find a “HELLO KITTY CAFE”?
Show less
A Wonderful Maze Of Shops And Restaurants
Wander the paths through fountains and grand avenues to shops and restaurants not seen elsewhere in the area. The theater is one of my favorites.

The Irvine Spectrum is a great place to shop and eat and see a movie. It is easy to get to, nestled between the 5Fwy and the 405Fwy, where they merge. There is plenty of parking and a variety of shops and restaurants and a big movie theater. Typically I avoid the weekend crowds and go during the week.
Show less
Clean Mall with Pretty Good Selection of Stores.

The Irvine Spectrum is a great place to hangout for the evening or afternoon if you are in the OC area. The shops comprise of a good amount of smaller named stores that I believe are residents to the CA area. There are also your more mainstream businesses here as well so it is a nice blend.

Traveler Tip: The crowd is a lot of teenagers/college kids from the local schools mixed together with business men and women.

Overall: A pretty good outdoor center with decent shopping options and restaurants.

I'm a fellow traveler so I appreciate when other people have given me tips/recommendations while in a new city. If this information is helpful, please let me know by hitting the like button. Even if this review helps only one traveler then it's worth it to know I'm contributing towards making someone's experience better, giving to the global community, and paying it forward. Safe Travels!
Show less
One look at the mulling crowd and it’s easy to see that this is a dream place for the young. It teems with youth. So that make it interesting even if we older folk find it’s sprawl a bit difficult.
Great place to see a movie, shop, or get a bite to eat. Always beautiful and clean. Love See's candy!
It just such a comfortable environment. No matter what time of the season or day of the week.
There are so many things to do here. From movies, to comedy club, dinner or just to hang out and shop. It is honestly such an awesome place to go with friends or family.

Irvine Spectrum is a destination for Orange County and even for visitors from far away countries. Upscale shops, restaurants for any budget, movie theater with IMAX and visual interest everywhere you look with fountains, ferris wheel, merry-go-round and other delights for children and all who are young at heart. Best of all, our Labradoodle is welcome everywhere. We love to shop, eat, and go to movies in this huge and friendly center.
Show less
shop, eat and drink then watch a movie or go to a comedy club all in one place that is pretty spectacular it is a bit on the pricey side however if you are on R&R who cares.

It has a lot of brands both for shopping and eating. Neat and clean with lots of washrooms if you need to visit.

Has a large Target store which is very customer friendly.

Lots of sitting places for you to rest incase you get tired of walking. The area is all walking and kids friendly. There is ice skating, merry go round, carousal etc for kids to enjoy, Cinemas for you to chill if you want to.

Good place to spend a few hours shopping.
Show less
Corporation Have Taken Over The Spectrum

I have lived in Irvine for over 15 years and over the past 6 plus years the Irvine Spectrum Center has become a place for large corporate establishments, because they are the only ones who can afford the ridiculous rents the Irvine Company is charging. The have completely eliminated the independent restaurants, the night life entertainment and have turned the place into an overpriced outdoor mall that lacks any individuality. The Irvine Company has been destroying Irvine for years, they don;t give a crap about the people who live there anymore.
Show less
Irvine Spectrum Complex is a great choice for those who want to shop in peace, with a great selection of shops, restaurants and coffee shops
It's very beautiful place to spend your time at. Big cinema, a lot of well known and different restaurants and nice shops

I always enjoy the Irvine Spectrum especially in the evening during the summer. Fun for the entire family. They have an entire children’s section with rides, play area, shops and food. Splash pad just arrived this year. You can get a good workout if you see the entire mall. Plenty of seating along the path if you need to rest or just want to people watch. Shopping for everyone. Many nice restaurants as well as fast food and desserts of all types. Movie theater as well. Tons of parking. Easy access off the 405 or 5 Fwys. Anchor stores are Nordstrom and Target.
Show less
A good shopping venue experience for families.
A very pleasant shopping mall and entertainment center... Especially good for families and kids due to the activities available, like fairground rides.

This really is a great shopping mall, but my favorite part of this center is that they have a fantastic Javiers Restaurant here with a large open air patio seating option. My favorite go to items are the skinny margaritas and ceveche ahi. Every menu item I've tried is fantastic.
Show less
DEPENDS ON WHEN YOU WERE BORN

If you are NOT of the MILLENNIUM GENERATION, I DON"T see much attraction to go visit this place. The shops cater to the MILLENNIAL GENERATION for which my definition of them is (the Millennial generation’s confidence has been argued to spill over into the realms of entitlement and narcissism.) OVER PRICED FOOD EATERIES, overrun by the young MILLENNIUM ADULTS, for which I have NO USE FOR just like they have for those of us born in the 1940's. Therefore I don't have a need to go there.
Show less

Irvine spectrum is one of my favorite spots in Irvine. It has all that you need for a family afternoon outing. The restaurants are great. Lots of variety when it comes to food. You have a big movie theater and major stores. At night the spectrum makes a good place to walk around and relax. The parking situation is getting harder and harder as they are expanding but I hope they can continue to make parking available.
Show less
The Spectrum has lots of pretty water fountains, a fun ferris wheel, tons of places to eat, fabulous parking and lots of shops.
For an outside Mall this is a very nice one. Lots of great stores and restaurants. It is very well kept and have not encountered any problems there.
Fun place to hang out and shop on a Friday night
Took the family here on a recent trip to Orange County. Nice outdoor mall with plenty to do. Wahoos was delicious as was the ice cream shop Cream. Upscale clean mall. Activities for all
Multiple types of food restaurants, clothing and retail shops in this mercantile collection with a pedestrian mall and a parking garage attached.
Something for everyone and all ages

It's easy to spend an entire day here and not get bored. For the smaller kids there are rides and trains to keep their interest. For the middle level age kids there are rides, candy stores, Dave and Busters, and 7D ride to enjoy. For the teenagers who want to just hang out together this is a great spot to meet up and check out Zummies, Old Navy, and other trendy stores to get their fashion on. They look at this stuff for hours, not purchasing anything, just talking about the cool tshirt designs. Jonny Rockets, Rubys, Subway, and Chiptole are great family hangout spots and the theater has all the latest titles and recliner seats that the entire family will love. And while the kids are having fun, there are some spectacular high end places to eat and drink for the adults. And did I mention the Irvine Improv is there. Simply put, it is a great place to connect with friends and family no matter what your age or interest.
Show less
A great place to shop, meet up with friends and family and many places to eat. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy the sun
It's a colourful place with many decent restaurants and good place to hang out. Place has huge parking. Nice place to spend evening and have a good meal.
There's everything you need. Name it and it's there. Restaurants, shopping, place for kids to play. It's not even much crowded
We stopped in for an early dinner and some shopping and enjoyed some also fresco dining with great sunshine and relaxing breezes.

Very convenient and nice assembly of shops, restaurants and entertainment venues. Range of restaurants go from fast food to deluxe sit down facilities. Shops range from family shopping to upscale boutiques and quality department stores. Movie complex is modern and large number of screens offer good variety of current releases.
Show less
A good selection of restaurants and plenty of shops to look at afterward, so you can walk off your dinner.

This place was buzzin. We spent a weekend in Irvine right next to the Spectrum and I'm glad we were there. This place was full of people. The shops were mid to high end. The restaurant selection was unlimited. There is something for everyone.

At the Irvine Spectrum you will not struggle finding a great place to eat or something fun to do. From Dave and Busters to the movie theater there is something to satisfy everyone's desires and from Tender Greens to Cucina Enoteca there someting to satisfy everyone's taste buds.
Show less

I like the Spectrum. Plenty of shopping of all sorts. (Just like a good mall, but outdoors.) Loads of eateries, from casual to high-end. Large cinema complex, Improv comedy. Lots of parking, both self and valet.
I really like the way they design the new parking lot, with Valle parking, I think the whole area belong to Irvin co, and they really made great ideas for Valle parking improvement
Irvine spectrum is not a classic American malls type, many different shops including amazing restaurant options but the most important point is: you walk and enjoy, you feel like you are in Europe!
A great place to bring visitors as it has all the restaurants you would want and a great variety of shops---great place for teenagers
Join in if you like crowds

First the bad news. Parking can be a nightmare on weekends - everyone is aggressively looking for a parking place. Valet is available. Completely outdoors so there are few places to rest out of sun. Packed with groups of young people on sunny weekends. Many kiosks line walkways urging you try samples. I find it much more hectic and less appealing than Fashion Island that is also outdoors. The good news is that there is a store to please everyone from Nordstrom shoppers to value priced teen clothing and jewelry stores.You won't find the real high end stores like Fashion Island and South Coast Plaza and so this center attracts many young people. Many restaurant choices from casual like Chipotle to finer dining like Cucina Enoteca. Practically all well known chains have their restaurants here. There is a Ferris wheel for those inclined and a train on wheels. The movie theater is cavernous with many theaters showing a wide choice of top movies day and night. I am a senior and honestly, I avoid this place like the plague on weekends and only go weekdays occasionally for the restaurants since I prefer shopping in more high end stores in other centers such as the two mentioned above. The Nordstroms at South Coast is much better.
Show less
Look at it this way, it's "downtown" Irvine with all of the city's good and bad in one place

Here's the good....safe, clean, tons of ways to spend money on things you don't need, lots of people, wide variety of places to eat food you shouldn't and a robot security guard.

Here's the bad...overcrowded on weekends, ridiculously high prices for things you don't need, bad nutritional choices, distances from where you park to the shops on a scale typically found only in Las Vegas, and beige walls for as far as the eye can see.
Show less
Great place to be able to do some shopping even with kids in tow. The carousel is great and there are lots of restaurants too.

While shopping was not really our purpose for visiting, the selection of stores and restaurants is great. The architecture and fountains are beautiful and relaxing. Fun area for kids with a grassy play area, Miss Kitty cafe and a mini train ride. Several great ice cream places too! Well worth the visit!
Show less

Met friends for lunch at this outdoor mall. It's great to walk around in the sunshine, watching people & window shopping. There are a variety of restaurants to choose from...Asian, hamburgers, pizza, pasta, Mexican, etc. You could spend hours here!

While we do have entertainment centers here in our area in AZ, none can compete w/ the Spectrum. Every time we visit family now-we always want to take a few hours to walk around, see what's new and have a great meal-of which there are a LOT of choices! We can do anything from fast food to fine dining and shop for anything from toiletries to designer clothes!
Show less
It's a great mall. Much better expierience than walking the giant indoor malls. Wish every mall was this cool. Def great if I was local.

I never liked this center but I thought I would give it another try. Well I'm still convenienced that I'm not sold on this center. Nothing Wowed about it. However there were a number of good restaurants.
Tons of stores something for everyone. Great variety of shops and restaurants. Areas to just sit and people watch.
Lots of stores. Lots of food options. Plenty of parking. Not as nice as Fashion Island, but very close.

Great ambiance and food, entertainment and retail shopping available for all age groups. Best aspect is the social and rest spots available for relaxing and enjoying the occasion.
The restaurants are plenty and offerings to suit all pallets. Theatre's for film and Improv, video entertainment, numerous fountains, cafes and retail with broad offerings. Shaded for hot days and sheltered for the cooler days. Carousal, train rides and fairs-wheel for the young at heart.
Show less

Special "back to School" events by retailers all day. Free concert by Hanna Eyre from "The Voice" fame and " The Young Americans". The spectrum offers tremendous variety in shopping, entertainment, restaurants and convenient parking.

For years my family has been coming here when in CA for the food, shops and people in the Spectrum. Rides for kids, Dave and Busters, Woodranch, Cheesecake Factory and shopping galore. All good stuff here.
I was here with my daughter, 13 years old, and there was plenty of good shops for teenagers. The cinema looked nice but we never visited. We had dinner at two places and they were ok. As expected.
Good and varied outdoor shopping complex, good parking, many options for dining and entertainment. Clean, upscale, modern feel.
Great place for shopping (my daughter loves Irvine Spectrum) and good restaurant options, which I like.
If you don't mind the limited parking, you can spend hours here as there are tons of shops and restaurants. A wide range for all tastes and budgets.
Great place to spend the day

Great outdoor shopping & dining plaza. Lots of covered shade to walk around while you shop, & chairs to sit & hang outdoors. There's a movie theater & great restaurants to try out each time you visit. Lots of places to get a yummy dessert. A large Ferris wheel that lights up at night. Parking surrounds the Spectrum with outdoor & covered lots, but can get busy on the weekends & during lunch on the weekdays. There's something for everyone!
Show less

Date night at the improv. Convenient valet parking, no wait to get in, always nice. Food is actually pretty good. Service has improved a lot. Saw Andrew Santino. Great time. Seating a little cramped but it wasn't a full house
This place has several stores, restaurants and ferris wheel which is open on weekends. It's a good place to people watch, relax or have a bite to eat in the evening time. Spacious parking.

Always fun to walk either to go to a movie, eat at restaurants or ice cream stores or Cheesecake Factory. Clothing stores are also great. And The Improv and Dave and Busters. Everything to have fun at this Center and so close to where I live. Perfect!

Show less

Restaurants and shops are fine, movies theater is terrific, but overall, its high priced and parking can be daunting on some sides. They are under constant construction (annoying). Overall, not a bad afternoon, but I prefer Fashion Island.
Good shopping centre. Excellent restaurants. Good food. Children amusement rides too to keep them engrossed. Must visit hangout place.
If you want to go shopping, this is the place, it's got it all.

Irvine spectrum center has everything you need, such as books, cloths, restaurants, cafe, and a movie theater. It is a great plaza to go shopping with families and friends. A must visit if you're ever in Irvine!
This is a large outdoor mall, with plenty of dining options. If you're looking to shop this os a good place to do it.
Pet friendly, relaxing place for teenagers who like shopping

This mall is great for teenagers who want to see a movie and shop with their friends. It is smaller , more relaxed than Fashion Islander or South Coast Plaza. It is a shame that they lost big stores like Macy's, but Nordstrom is still there. It is easy to find great restaurants for vegetarians and to find a variety of food. There are not a lot of good deals but there are a lot of kids and pet friendly places.
Show less

Always a fun and pleasant shopping experience. A few unique restaurants, cafes, and even a dim sum place. A very good selection of chain restaurants as well. It's such a multifaceted and fun shopping center to browse and eat. It's also a happening place to hang out. Highly recommended.
Show less
Good place for a walk and shop!
I like the area for a good walk around, and plenty of shops too! Besides you have a dozen good places to choose from for dinner and drinks options.
Wonderful outdoor Shopping in the junction of 405 and 5 freeway

Spectrum is an wonderful place, large movie theater, many stores and very good options for fine dinner and fast food! Kids usually love the fountain during the summer and the ice ring during the winter!
1-nice place 2- many shops, stores and restaurants 3- clean 4- with the visit 5- Apple Store 6- movie theatres
My family had a great visit to the spectrum. Parking was free, the atmosphere is great, and my 2 year old daughter loved the carousel. I highly recommend.

It is a nice place where you an find all what you want . Apple store there is really nice and big . There is target and nordstorm as well . There is a carousel for kids in the middle if the center and a lot of restaurants if you can ant to have your lunch or dinner . We saw that there is cinema but we didnt tru it . It is a must visit place if you are near orange country
Show less
This mall is awesome! It is outdoors so it is super nice! A lot of variety of stores and restaurants! I totally loved it!
Quite an high end shopping mall. Lots of shops and restaurants. Just need to walk from end to end to enjoy a relaxing shopping experience. Nice to come late afternoon as it will be cooler in summer.

This outdoor center is clean, appears safe and is well attended. Outdoor spaces are kept up well. Super fun to people watch. Tons of stores, many events at many stores, movie theater, and restaurants! There is a nice nail salon too.
Adding even more restaurants and retail spaces. Parking is easy, they have valet and you can have food delivered to your car curbside from the restaurants. Oh, and in the parking structure you can opt to have your car detailed while shopping! I love this part of California Living!
Show less
Disneyland for Shoppers at this Southern California Destination!

Californians tend to "go big" when they do things. Examples: We are the home of Disney, Hollywood, Apple...and just look a our freeway system! We've now taken shopping to that level with the Irvine Spectrum. Located in Irvine...a master planned, picture perfect SoCal community, the Spectrum beckons shoppers and foodies alike. As locals, we often joke that eating our way through the Spectrum is a perfect way to spend an afternoon. Lots of restaurants to choose from, a wide variety of stores ranging from Target to Nordstroms, entertainment including an Edwards megaplex, and Dave &Busters, Barnes and Noble bookstore, an Apple Store, and many other options. Plenty of places to sit and people watch, often there is live music on a Friday or Saturday in the summer, a mini ice rink in the winter, and a Ferris Wheel to get a birds eye view of the area year round. It's a nice place to visit.
Show less
Great mall, can spend hours there

The Spectrum is well equipped with a wide variety of shops and eateries. From a Target department store; to clothing stores such as H&M, Charlotte Russe and Old Navy; to restaurants such as Red Robin, PF Chang's, California Pizza Kitchen, and Ruby's Diner. TLT is a particular favorite, serving mexican cuisine such as tacos and nachos with a twist.
The main attraction is obviously the Irvine Spectrum big wheel and the carousel (a favorite with kids).
Would definitely recommend, especially as a family outing.
Show less

I often go to the Spectrum Center in Irvine this is an amazing place that has everything for the family including restaurants shopping and entertainment. It's very clean and safe for whole family. Plenty of areas to valet and Park

Offer lots of choices for dinning and shopping within the mid price tag. One of the newer shopping malls I have visited. Visited the place over 4-5 trips as shopping mall is nearest to our hotel. Recommend Umami burger - Japanese styled burgers with good sizing.

FUN FOR EVERYONE: SHOP, EAT, DRINK, LISTEN, DANCE AND PEOPLE WATCH - THE NEW URBAN DOWNTOWN OF SOUTH ORANGE COUNTY

Located seven miles south of the John Wayne Airport (SNA) in the northwest quadrant of the I-5 and the I-405 freeway interchange via the Alton Parkway or the Irvine Center Drive, the sheik, modern, open-air IRVINE SPECTRUM CENTER, the new metropolitan downtown of South Orange County, offers a “naturalize” urban environment in which to shop, eat, drink, listen, dance and people watch. Blessed with bright and sunny skies year round (average of 70 degrees) the Spectrum celebrates the Orange County outdoor lifestyle. The unusual architectural design inspired by the Alhambra (Granada, Spain) is the setting for an amazing array of urban amenities, like the white obelisk landmark that changes color, the digitally lighted Giant Ferris Wheel crafted in Italy (you can see it miles away on the 405), the colorful carousel with its menagerie of animals, and the Alhambra inspired Court of the Lions fountain. Of course, there are cinemas, bars, restaurants, concerts, and department stores. Unlike other large shopping centers, the Spectrum provides an abundance of structured parking and at least a hundred chairs and couches were to sit and enjoy the weather. While there my favorite pastime is people watching: every age, size, and type.
Show less
I love shopping, eating, looking around & the cinema VIP. Really nice places to eat outside. All shop staff very helpful

I've watched this place grow, but the problem is, it never stops growing. Even just a few years ago, I could go here on a 1-hour lunch break and make it back to work in time. Not now. Don't even think about it on a Friday or Saturday. It's become so crowded, there's now people directing traffic. This place is a like a marriage of a mall and Disneyland. You'll spend a lot of money and wait in line to do so. Irvine, do yourselves a favor and stop trying to build and expand this area. The traffic here, and surrounding, has become a nightmare. Being in Irvine temporarily means that the Spectrum is our 'local' mall. It's about 7-8 miles from our location, off the 405 near John Wayne airport...Or 8.5 miles if you walk there following the San Diego creek. The mall is a modern, outdoor mall with a nice selection of shops from Target to Nordstrom's. There's also a variety of choices for places to eat from Dave and Buster's to Ruby's diner (great, in expensive food... Try the cheeseburger). All in all, typical American shopping experience but with few 'outlet' type shops so you won't get as many deals.

There's also stuff for kids including a Ferris wheel...

Here in Orange County, having a mall indoors is not a requirement. The Irvine Spectrum is large, outdoors, and has tons of eating from fast food to fine dining. Somehow, this place is more fun to go than other malls; I do not like malls generally, and this one tops my list.

If you want to enjoy the outdoor ambiance of what SoCal has to offer, I highly recommend shopping at the Irvine Spectrum. They look great after the renovation with great stores that will fit your budget. It's more reasonable than the South Coast Plaza and it offers casual dining that are ideal for the entire family. Food outlet options are much better than the South Coast Plaza with high quality restaurants. The only negative thing I can think of for this place is parking. Don't go around noon and after 5pm, it'll frustrate you to find a parking spot. It may take up to 25 mins to find something close unless you don't mind walking at a distance. Also, make sure you remember where you park. Parking lots all look exactly the same and if you don't remember which building you are in, you can get quite lost and think your car got stolen. It's hard to differentiate the buildings since they all have exactly the same look and same car wash in all of them. So remember the building name.

The Irvine Spectrum Center is an outdoorshopping center developed by the Irvine Company, located on the southeast edge ofIrvine, California, US. The mall features an Edwards 21-screen movie theater.[1] Built over a 10-year period, the first phase of the center opened in 1995 and the second phase followed in 1998. The third phase was completed in 2002. The fourth and fifth phases were built and completed between 2005 and 2006. The mall is used forestablishing shots of the fictional "Mall of Miami" in the Disney Channel television seriesAustin and Ally.

Edwards CinemasEdit

The 21-screen movie theater was once the largest movie theater in the western United States.[citation needed] During development, the Edwards company code-named it "The Big One". This remained the movie theater's nickname for a while thereafter until other theaters eclipsed its screen count, particularly AMC's 30-screen complex at The Block at Orange. The theater bore over two miles of pink and purple neon lights.

....with many restaurants. Beautiful Moroccan architecture. Great for strolling and shopping. Merry go round for both adults and kids. Gets busy on weekends/evenings.

Stay away on weekends unless you're between 14 and 24. Great dining,, inexpensive to fine,. Free garage and inexpensive valet. $(4.00) I eat lunch there often, but stay away from movies and walking areas from Friday night to Monday afternoon.

The Irvine Spectrum is one of my favorite outdoor malls. It is clean, secure, well-lit, and there is ample parking. I feel very comfortable dropping off my teenage child with friends here on a Saturday night.

You will find a large movie theater (with 21 Theaters inside), and tons of restaurants. There's also a Dave & Buster's, as well as a merry-go-round, a ferris wheel, and various game venues. For example, there's a 3D ride, and in the winter time there is an actual ice skating ring!

There's also tons of shopping, with everything from Target to Macy's to Nordstrom's, as well as small boutiques. The restaurant options are unparalleled, you can go budget at Subway to upscale at PF Changs, with everything in between.

This mall is a great first step for younger teens wanting to spread their wings, in my humble opinion. Parents can enjoy an upscale dinner while kids hang out at the movies or shopping. The mall is so big, you probably won't run into each other, but you'll be close enough in case they need you.
